Burden of Truth

Dimly lit room, tension between two characters.  
Sonia feels his pain.  
Raskolnikov: “You won’t understand, only suffer.”  

Sonia: “But aren’t you suffering, too?”  

Raskolnikov: “I have a bad heart. I am a coward.”  
Raskolnikov: “Why did I come? I’ll never forgive myself.”  

---  

Sonia: “It’s better I should know!”  
Raskolnikov: “I wanted to become a Napoleon… that’s why I killed her.”  

Sonia: “N-no, only speak! I shall understand!”  
Raskolnikov: “You’ll understand? Very well, we shall see!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confesses to Sonia that his desire to become a great figure like Napoleon motivated his crime, revealing his inner turmoil and sense of guilt.
